how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Task and project management (including CRMs);Worldbuilding (e.g. for role-playing games)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
putting it all together, what value does: Open format and multi platform notebook that can hold links, metadata, media, etc.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable writing filter expressions
how do you back up/sync changes between: Web or cloud hosting (other than TiddlyHost/TiddlySpot e.g. Netlify, AWS, OVH, Google Cloud...);DIY (any other solution)
as you selected diy, would be grateful f: Syncthing between my computers and phone with a backup to Dropbox

outside of plugins, palettes and other i: Previously used the Material themes, but removed once the built-in dark theme was better usable.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin:
The open platform and wide range of community plugins. Especially important that I can use and access it on all of my devices including phone and separate computers.
Also especially critical that it runs without an external server, so I could use it for internships where my work couldn''t be disseminated or stored in external systems.
what could we do better? prompts for thi:
I could see leaving for something like Obsidian. The recent surge in markdown note-taking and knowledge management systems is tempting, but I mostly stick to Tiddlywiki for familiarity and the setup I've already curated.
It does seem like TW has the possibility of getting stalled in development, particularly with one main developer.
I think TW could use some improvements in loading performance, particularly with the NodeJS version which seems like it could be better optimized.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
